meanings.definition: To break or divide into fragments.
meanings.sent1: She was fragmentizing the old vase to create a mosaic.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake was fragmentizing the once sturdy building.
meanings.sent3: The kids were fragmentizing the pinata with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brushstrokes were fragmentizing the canvas into a beautiful chaos.
meanings.sent5: The sound of glass fragmentizing on the floor echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: To cause something to break or divide into fragments.
meanings.sent1: The explosion fragmentized the rock into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent2: The strong winds were fragmentizing the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally fragmentized the cake while trying to cut it.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident fragmentized the family's peace of mind.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat was fragmentizing the ice sculpture slowly but surely.
